content: The "Rural Hospital Relief Act of 1999" is cited in this Act. It amends the Social Security Act to adjust the calculation of base amounts for Medicare OPD PPS. The amendment aims to limit reductions in federal payments under OPD PPS. SEC. 4 amends the Social Security Act to exclude ambulance services for outpatient dialysis patients from SNF PPS. Effective from January 1, 2000. SEC. 5 addresses standards and treatment of critical access hospitals. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act regarding limitations on beds and length of stay in critical access hospitals. Amendments to the Social Security Act include the exclusion of swing-bed days from SNF PPS and the restoration of Medicare payments for bad debt. Effective dates for these changes vary. SEC. 8. TEMPORARY EXEMPTION OF RURAL HEALTH CLINICS FROM PRODUCTIVITY STANDARDS. The Secretary may not apply productivity guidelines for rural health clinics' costs in 1998-2001. SEC. 9. INFLATION UPDATES FOR RURAL PROVIDERS. Hospitals and skilled nursing facilities in rural areas are amended to receive market basket percentage increases, with specific updates for urban areas. The Act and its amendments require an official budget request designated as an emergency requirement by the President and Congress.
